sub_topic: Calculation of latent heat of vaporization of a substance
message_1: What is the latent heat of vaporization of water, given that 10 grams of water at its boiling point absorbs 2257 Joules of heat energy to completely vaporize?
message_2:
The latent heat of vaporization (L) can be calculated using the formula:

L = Q / m

where Q is the heat energy absorbed (2257 Joules) and m is the mass of the water (10 grams).

L = 2257 J / 10 g = 225.7 J/g

The latent heat of vaporization of water is 225.7 Joules per gram.
